Description: Limestone figure fragment of a left shoulder and upper arm. Probably bare and from a nude male (kouros?), figure. The shoulder is very broad, rounded and sloping, joined to a tubular torso. The left arm is not flat against his side, but instead angled forward, as on other examples that hold something (an offering?) to their chest.
Curator's comments: Shoulder fragment of kouros figure of Cypriot origin. See also musicians (British Museum GR 1863,0127.4, 1860,0404.98) dated early 6th century BC. See kouros figures in alabaster that have a similar placement of the arm (GR 1888,0601.14 ; particularly GR 1886,0401.1383) dated 580BC-570BC. Other traditional Cypriot examples holding offerings are usually dressed and have a simple flat back.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (CD.025) (Phase 3)
